programme.desc: Bradley and Billy discover that the Yucatan thorn forest is the ideal home for the tough spiny-tailed iguana, but a perilous place for thin-skinned humans.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: When a puppy is found abandoned with a broken leg, Dr. Jeff is his only hope to walk again. Then, the team cares for a familys terrier who shows signs of a serious illness, and Dr. Baier and Hector head out to treat rescued pigs.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A young mans pet goat is injured in a freak accident. Can Dr Jeff help? Gus, a dog, has swallowed a mysterious object and has been unwell since.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins

programme.desc: Hunter the tiger is being sedated for his annual eye check, allowing Terri to get close. Bindi puts on a birthday party for Minibus - the Zoos oldest Wombat.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio and his team look back on some of their biggest and best builds. And, grateful owners give an update on how much the animals are enjoying their new cribs.

programme.desc: Wayde and Brett make a tank for world famous artist and DJ Redfoo of the band LMFAO. The guys attempt their very first one of a kind DJ booth aquarium. Will this tank be able to get the party started?

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A company designing customisations for high-end and rare vehicles wants an exotic fish tank. They want a huge, three-sided build as their centrepiece.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: NASCAR driver Kurt Busch and his wife want a little piece of paradise inside their aquarium. They want to replicate their wedding location!

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: When puppy Murphy eats a piece of his basket, an operation to remove the piece reveals an abnormal blood vessel. Surgeon Kathryn is shocked at its size; can she cure him?

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Zoo staff face unexpected setbacks weaning a bright sea lion pup off her mothers milk. And, the bird team steps in to support a rejected curassow chick.

programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: The Alaskans are desperate to fill their smokehouses before winter. The Seldens help haul home Tylers moose kill. Heimo and Charlie worry about a lack of meat.

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest delves into the island of Java in Indonesia, seeking the Javan tiger. It was declared extinct in 2003, but there have been recent reported sightings.

programme.title: Bad Dog
programme.desc: A dog digs ditches in its backyard and his owners use a bulldozer to fill them in. Plus, goats run amok at a birthday party and a dog steals underwear from its owner.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: With winter closing in, the Wolfpack races to build their homes before the ground begins to freeze. Later, a snowstorm threatens progress as they haul Bears new house--a shipping container--up to the highest peak on the mountain.

programme.title: Insekten - Die heimlichen Herrscher
programme.desc: Gottesanbeterinnen und Wasserinsekten zahlen zu den "Gefurchteten Raubern" unter den Insekten. Sie sind scharfsinnige Überlebenskunstler. Ihre Korper sind todliche Waffe und Tarnanzug zugleich. Jagen sichert ihnen das Überleben, weshalb sich rauberisch lebende Insekten im Laufe der Evolution weiterentwickelt und ihre Jagdstrategien perfektioniert haben.

programme.title: Medizin in fernen Landern
programme.desc: Die Winter in den direkt sudlich des Polarkreises gelegenen Regionen sind hart. Taglich muss man mit Kalte und Dunkelheit kampfen, der Organismus muss sich anpassen. Die 323.000 Bewohner Islands scheinen besonders resistent gegen diese Bedingungen zu sein, da hier weitaus weniger Winterdepressionen auftreten als in anderen Landern auf denselben Breitengraden. Zusammen mit der Schlafforscherin Erla Bjornsdottir untersucht Bernard Fontanille die Auswirkungen der im Winter beinahe ununterbrochen anhaltenden Dunkelheit auf Korper und Geist. AuSSerdem trifft er Thorunn, eine 50-jahrige Bewohnerin der islandischen Hauptstadt Reykjavik. Wie die meisten Islander badet auch sie im Winter regelmaSSig abwechselnd in eiskalten und geothermisch erhitzten Quellen.

programme.title: Kidnapping
programme.desc: Von Julita fehlt noch immer jede Spur. Rolf befurchtet, sie konnte in eine Transplantationsklinik in Rumanien verschleppt worden sein. Doch vor Ort findet er heraus: Der Spender fur die Niere eines Patienten ist Mario – der anscheinend auch den Transporter gefahren hat, in dem Julita entfuhrt wurde. Um sich und seine Schwester Nico zu befreien, muss Mario den Anweisungen der Entfuhrer Folge leisten ... In Danemark droht derweil Rolfs Geheimnis uber Hania/Andrea aufzufliegen.

programme.title: Mit offenen Karten
programme.desc: Nach dem Sturz von Baschar al-Assad im Dezember 2024 hat der ehemalige Dschihadist Ahmed al-Scharaa nun die Fuhrung Syriens ubernommen. Mit dem Ende des Krieges stehen den Menschen in diesem zerrutteten Staat groSSe Herausforderungen bevor: Sie mussen ein zerstortes Land wieder aufbauen, eine Vielzahl an Gemeinschaften mit gegensatzlichen Weltanschauungen zum friedlichen Miteinander bewegen und eine vom Krieg gezeichnete Gesellschaft starken.

programme.title: Wer nicht fragt, stirbt dumm!
programme.desc: Das Kurzprogramm mit Professor Schnauzbart ist todkomisches Schulfernsehen fur Erwachsene oder auch schrage Wissenschaft fur Oberschlaue. Es beruht auf dem beliebten franzosischen Blog "Tu mourras moins bete" von Marion Montaigne. In dieser Folge: Ist es richtig, dass man abnimmt, wenn man taglich zwei Liegestutzen macht?

programme.title: 28 Minuten
programme.desc: Die haitianische Schriftstellerin Yanick Lahens veroffentlicht „Passagères de nuit“, eine Geschichte uber weiblichen Widerstand und Flucht, die zwischen Haiti und New Orleans spielt. / Seit zehn Tagen stellt die Gen Z 212 die marrokanischen Machthaber infrage. Das Land, das 2011 keinen „Arabischen Fruhling“ erlebt hat, sieht sich heute mit einer Revolte der Jugend konfrontiert.

programme.title: Donatello, Schopfer der Renaissance
programme.desc: Donatello ist bereits zu Lebzeiten eine Legende. Der Bildhauer ist der Urvater der Hochrenaissance und Wegbereiter fur Kunstler wie Raffael oder Michelangelo. Seine Bronzeskulptur des "David" oder die "Pazzi-Madonna" aus Marmor sind Ikonen der Kunstgeschichte und zeugen von seiner bildhauerischen Erneuerungskraft.

programme.title: Freddie Mercury - The Great Pretender
programme.desc: Er war eine der charismatischsten und facettenreichsten Figuren des britischen Rock: Freddie Mercury. Interviews, Konzertmitschnitte, Videos und privates Filmmaterial sowie jungere Interviews mit Freunden und Kunstlerkollegen zeigen den Menschen Mercury hinter dem schillernden Superstar.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Hoch im Norden, im sturmischen Nordatlantik, liegen die Faroer, ein Archipel von 18 Inseln. Die Natur, rau und urtumlich, hat das Leben der Bewohner stark gepragt. Schon als die Wikinger aus dem heutigen Norwegen die Faroer bevolkerten, war der Bootsverkehr zwischen den Inseln uberlebenswichtig. Er sicherte vor allem die Grundversorgung der Bewohner durch die Fischerei. Rudern ist heute Nationalsport, und Frauen sind schon lange mit am Start.

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: Sie sind der Inbegriff der Gemutlichkeit im Meer: Rundschwanzseekuhe, auch Manatis genannt. Ruhig und behabig lassen sie sich treiben und allzu gern laben sie sich genussvoll am Seegras der Karibik. Obwohl sie keine naturlichen Feinde haben, ist ihr Bestand massiv bedroht, und zwar durch Motorboote, die die Tiere immer wieder verletzen.

programme.title: Stadt Land Kunst Spezial
programme.desc: "Stadt Land Kunst Spezial" am Wochenende – das sind drei spannende Entdeckungen an einem Ort. In dieser Folge: Spezial Laos: (1) Marc Leguays zauberhaftes Laos (2) Der Kaffee vom Bolaven-Plateau (3) Das absolute Muss: Laos und sein bretonischer Nationalheld

programme.title: Stadt Land Kunst Spezial
programme.desc: "Stadt Land Kunst Spezial" am Wochenende – das sind drei spannende Entdeckungen an einem Ort. In dieser Folge: Spezial Peru: Irving Penns Liebe auf den ersten Blick/ Der Titicacasee, Zuflucht der Andenvolker/ Das absolute Muss: Machu Picchu

programme.title: Kostliche Emilia-Romagna
programme.desc: Die erste Folge fuhrt nach Parma und Reggio Emilia, wo die Po-Ebene und die Hugel ideale Bedingungen fur kulinarische Kostlichkeiten bieten. In Soragna steht der Culatello, einer der edelsten Schinken Italiens, im Fokus. In Langhirano begeistert die "Torta Rossa", der rote Kuchen. Bei Reggio Emilia liefern die "Roten Kuhe" die Milch fur besonders schmackhaften Parmigiano Reggiano.

programme.title: Die Bienenflusterer
programme.desc: Die Dokureihe handelt von der einzigartigen Beziehung zwischen Menschen und Bienen. In 15 Geschichten von funf Kontinenten zeigt die Reihe die Schonheit und Vielfalt der Bienenvolker. In dieser Folge: In den Feuchtgebieten des Sentarum-Sees auf Borneo lebt die Riesenhonigbiene Apis dorsata. In den Waldern der Seenlandschaft baut sie ihre Nester in den Wipfeln der groSSen Baume.

programme.title: Tag der Wissenschaft
programme.desc: Die Folge "Unentbehrliche Winzlinge" befasst sich mit dem weltweiten Ruckgang von Insektenarten und legt den Fokus auf ihre Vielfalt und ihre Bedeutung fur die Umwelt. Forschende und Insektenbegeisterte enthullen Schonheit und Komplexitat dieser weltweit meistverbreiteten und gleichzeitig unbeliebtesten Tiere.

programme.title: Insekten - Die heimlichen Herrscher
programme.desc: In „Eifrige Bestauber” wird die weltweite Vielfalt von Bestauberinsekten untersucht. Tausende Wildbienen- und Schmetterlingsarten sorgen mit dafur, dass Felder und Walder fruchtbar bleiben. Sie spielen eine tragende Rolle fur die Ernahrung der Menschen und bringen zudem Farbe in die Welt. Dabei sind sie keineswegs empfindlich, sondern robuste und vielschichtige Lebewesen, die beeindruckende Verwandlungen durchlaufen und atemberaubende Wanderungen unternehmen.

programme.title: Das Biospharen-Experiment: 120 Tage in der Wuste
programme.desc: Vier Monate lang in der Wuste zu leben und dabei selbststandig und abfallfrei Wasser, Energie und Nahrung zu produzieren - das ist die Herausforderung, der sich Ingenieur Corentin de Chatelperron und Designerin Caroline Pultz stellen. Die beiden Lowtech-Spezialisten sind davon uberzeugt, dass diese nachhaltigen und leicht zuganglichen Techniken Zukunftsmusik sind.

programme.title: Todliche Angst
programme.desc: Der Journalist Bastien Grimaldy erhalt plotzlich anonyme Erpresserbriefe. Als den Bedrohungen Mordanschlage folgen, versucht Bastien auf eigene Faust, die Identitat des Taters zu ermitteln – und stoSSt dabei auf ein teuflisches Geheimnis in seiner eigenen Familie…

programme.title: Leuchtende Natur
programme.desc: Viele Lebewesen verfugen uber Fluoreszenz. Sie nutzen das Leuchten, um Paarungsbereitschaft zu signalisieren. In der ersten Folge zeigen Forschende anhand verschiedener Beispiele aus Fauna und Flora, wie Fluoreszenz zum Kriterium fur die Partnerwahl wird – vom Hochzeitstanz der Wellensittiche bis zu den doppeldeutigen Signalen der Gewachshausspringspinnen.

programme.title: Leuchtende Natur
programme.desc: Jungste Forschungsarbeiten eroffnen neue Einblicke in eine bisher weitgehend unsichtbare Welt: Manche Tiere oder Pflanzen strahlen in der Dunkelheit ein beinahe unwirklich erscheinendes Licht aus, um sich zu tarnen, um von sich abzulenken, um Fressfeinde zu orten oder um Beute anzulocken. Die zweite Folge zeigt auf, wie die Fluoreszenz das eigene Überleben sichern kann.

programme.title: ARTE Reportage
programme.desc: (1): Israel: Gespalten durch Krieg Der Krieg in Gaza spaltet die israelische Gesellschaft, die zwischen Waffenstillstand und Annexion schwankt. (2): Afghanistan: Frauen durfen nicht reisen Das Leben der Frauen in Afghanistan wird weiter von den Taliban eingeschrankt. Viele wollen fliehen, aber wie?

programme.title: Mit offenen Karten
programme.desc: Nach dem Sturz von Baschar al-Assad im Dezember 2024 hat der ehemalige Dschihadist Ahmed al-Scharaa nun die Fuhrung Syriens ubernommen. Mit dem Ende des Krieges stehen den Menschen in diesem zerrutteten Staat groSSe Herausforderungen bevor: Sie mussen ein zerstortes Land wieder aufbauen, eine Vielzahl an Gemeinschaften mit gegensatzlichen Weltanschauungen zum friedlichen Miteinander bewegen und eine vom Krieg gezeichnete Gesellschaft starken.

programme.title: Der Klang der Sinti - Frauenstimmen aus dem Elsass
programme.desc: Die Dokumentation erteilt vier Generationen von Sinti das Wort und wirft jenseits von Stereotypen einen liebevollen Blick auf eine Community, die seit dem 15. Jahrhundert im Elsass ansassig ist.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: ARTE Journal, das europaische Nachrichtenmagazin, wirft einen aktuellen, weltoffenen und europaischen Blick auf Politik und Kultur.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Einem jeden Kloster in Georgien werden traditionell vom Kirchenoberhaupt, dem Patriarchen, unterschiedliche Aufgaben zugewiesen. Dabei geht es darum, die Tradition des Landes und damit auch die der Georgisch-Orthodoxen Kirche zu bewahren. Einige Kloster widmen sich der Ikonenmalerei, andere produzieren auf althergebrachte Weise Wein oder pflegen die Gregorianische Gesangskultur. Wer aber kummert sich um den Nachwuchs der hier beheimateten Schaferhunde? Es ist Monch Iakobi in Westgeorgien.

programme.title: Planet Erde - Die Macht des Lebens
programme.desc: Die Dokumentation „Planet Erde – Die Macht des Lebens“ zeigt, wie die Entstehung des Lebens und das Aussehen unserer Erde einander beeinflusst haben. Pflanzen und Tiere gestalten Lebensraume immer wieder neu, aber auch unbelebte Materie, wie beispielsweise Gestein, spielt dabei eine Rolle. Der Mensch verandert diesen dynamischen Kreislauf jedoch gerade. Die Dokumentation zeichnet die Geschichte unseres Planeten nach, auf der die Menschheitsgeschichte nur einen kurzen Moment ausmacht.

programme.title: Darwin Express
programme.desc: Blumen ohne Farben, Elefanten ohne StoSSzahne, Kroten mit Superkraften: Überall auf der Erde verandern sich Lebewesen innerhalb weniger Generationen, viel schneller als Darwin es vorausgesagt hatte. Wie ist das moglich? Springende Gene, Epigenetik, phanotypische Plastizitat: Mithilfe renommierter Forscherinnen und Forscher aus aller Welt enthullt „Darwin Express“ die verborgenen Mechanismen der Evolution und zeigt, dass sich das Leben in Rekordzeit an neue Gegebenheiten anpassen kann.

programme.title: Achtung Orcas!
programme.desc: Seit dem Sommer 2020 werden Boote entlang der Atlantikkuste von der StraSSe von Gibraltar bis in die Biskaya im Norden immer wieder von Orcas angegriffen. Die Wale attackieren dabei zielstrebig die Ruder und zerstoren diese. Forschende versuchen herauszufinden, was sie antreibt. Neugier? Konkurrenz um Nahrung? Oder Spiel? Wahrend die Wissenschaft nach Antworten sucht, wird eines ganz klar: Wir Menschen dringen zu tief in den Lebensraum der Meeresbewohner ein und das bleibt nicht ohne Konsequenzen.

programme.title: Kurzschluss
programme.desc: (1): Quakkonzert (2): Das Madchen im Wasser (3): Nachtlicher Ausflug (4): Eine echt abgedrehte Geschichte (5): Gesprach (6): Der Ruf der Sirenen (7): Die purpurrote Jahreszeit

programme.title: Panik in der Pampa: Die groSSen Ferien
programme.desc: Es sind Schulferien und der Sommer zieht sich hin. Indianer und Cowboy langweilen sich. Pferd schleppt sie in ein verstaubtes Kino. Dort lauft ein toller alter Piratenfilm, der sie aus ihrer Antriebslosigkeit reiSSt ...

programme.title: 42 - Die Antwort auf fast alles
programme.desc: Musik besitzt eine immense Kraft: Sie kann uns tieftraurig stimmen, in Ekstase versetzen und uns die Welt vergessen lassen. Menschen auf der ganzen Welt musizieren und horen Musik. Kaum jemandem gelingt es, sich ihr zu entziehen. Selbst Babys zappeln zu rhythmischen Klangen. Doch worin besteht die Wirkkraft der Musik? Was bewegt uns eigentlich, wenn wir von Musik bewegt werden?

programme.title: Les hyènes, au-delà des prejuges
programme.desc: Contrairement à d’autres predateurs de la savane, la hyène n’a pas bonne presse. Souvent depeinte comme une charognarde lâche et sournoise au rire sinistre, elle possède des techniques uniques qui font d’elle une redoutable chasseuse. Capable de poursuivre ses proies sur des kilomètres, jusqu’à les epuiser, cet animal social chasse generalement en petit groupe, et fait preuve d’une grande adaptabilite.

programme.title: Les insectes, super-heros en minuscule
programme.desc: Les insectes ont beau etre tout petits, ils n’en demeurent pas moins impitoyables. De la mante religieuse, reine de l’embuscade, à la libellule, aux acrobaties assassines, les predateurs s’appuient sur une panoplie d’armes redoutables heritees de l’evolution. Mais au-delà de leur habilete à tuer, ces chasseurs ultraperformants jouent un rôle crucial au sein des ecosystèmes où ils règnent.

programme.title: Medecines dailleurs
programme.desc: Bernard Fontanille decouvre limpact de la nuit quasi permanente sur le fonctionnement du corps et de lesprit.

programme.title: Kidnapping
programme.desc: Sixième et dernier episode de lenquete du Danois Rolf Larsen et de sa consoeur française : une course contre la montre s’enclenche pour retrouver Julita, enlevee par les trafiquants.

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc: Cette semaine, "Le dessous des cartes" vous emmène en Syrie, un pays qui traverse un moment charnière de son histoire après la chute du regime de Bachar al-Assad. Après plus de cinquante ans de dictature, c’est Ahmed al-Charaa, un ancien djihadiste, qui a pris les renes d’un État devaste. Un nouveau chapitre s’ouvre, mais la paix demeure fragile dans ce pays aux multiples fractures.

programme.title: Donatello, genie de la Renaissance
programme.desc: Portrait du sculpteur Donatello (1386-1466), precurseur de la Haute Renaissance qui influença considerablement l’art sculptural par sa façon novatrice de concevoir l’espace.

programme.title: Freddie Mercury, The Great Pretender
programme.desc: À base darchives et de temoignages rares, un portrait passionnant de Freddie Mercury (1946-1991), le legendaire leader de Queen, enigmatique icône musicale aux multiples facettes.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Le trafic inter-îles etait dejà essentiel à l’epoque où les Vikings, originaires de l’actuelle Norvège, peuplaient les îles Feroe. Les navires approvisionnaient la population locale surtout en produits de la peche. Depuis, l’aviron a remplace les drakkars pour s’imposer comme sport national. Une activite que les femmes pratiquent de longue date.

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: Plongee au centre de soins de Porto Rico, qui recueille et traite les lamantins blesses.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Trois sujets pour decouvrir le Laos : les peintures de Marc Leguay, la culture du cafe, et le monastère de Wat Mai.

programme.title: Les delices d’Émilie-Romagne
programme.desc: Un delicieux voyage à la croisee des traditions culinaires du nord de lItalie. Cet episode nous emmène à Parme et dans louest de lÉmilie-Romagne, où se deploie une grande diversite de paysages, dont la celèbre plaine du Pô. Au menu : des tagliatelles issues de varietes anciennes de cereales, du parmesan au lait de vache rousse et le gâteau rouge de Langhirano.

programme.title: Les insectes, super-heros en minuscule
programme.desc: Moins populaires que les grands animaux, les insectes restent peu connus. Malgre leurs 400 millions d’annees d’evolution, ces petits invertebres disparaissent aujourd’hui à un rythme effrayant. Des scientifiques se mobilisent pour tenter de stopper leur disparition, qui met en peril l’ensemble du vivant.

programme.title: Les insectes, super-heros en minuscule
programme.desc: Un tiers de ce que nous mangeons est issu du labeur des pollinisateurs. Abeilles, mouches, papillons ou coleoptères, ils transportent le pollen des plantes à fleurs qui, ainsi fecondees, produisent des graines et des fruits. Mais si leur action savère necessaire à notre alimentation ainsi qu’à la survie de nombreux ecosystèmes, ces travailleurs silencieux sont dangereusement menaces par le derèglement climatique.

programme.title: La vie en fluo
programme.desc: Sur terre, sous l’eau ou dans les cieux, nombreux sont les animaux et les plantes à avoir developpe des couleurs chatoyantes, invisibles pour l’œil humain : la fluorescence. Mais à quoi leur sert cette particularite ? C’est un champ d’etudes passionnant, encore peu defriche par la science, qu’explore ce documentaire aux images de toute beaute.

programme.title: La vie en fluo
programme.desc: Nombreuses sont les espèces animales et vegetales à avoir developpe des couleurs chatoyantes, invisibles pour l’œil humain : la fluorescence. Comment ont-elles su exploiter cette faculte au service de la predation ou du camouflage - en un mot, de la survie ?

programme.title: La septième cible
programme.desc: Depuis peu, la vie de Bastien Grimaldy a vire au cauchemar : agressions, coups de telephone anonymes, chantage, demande de rançon... Qui le harcèle ? Il contacte la police, mais celle-ci le suspecte. Son entourage se trouble. Lancien grand reporter na plus le choix : il doit mener lenquete lui-meme.

programme.title: Les promesses de la terre
programme.desc: Territoires intermediaires entre plaines et montagnes, les plateaux forment de vastes etendues où l’elevage s’est impose comme l’une des principales activites. Mais, très exposes au vent et au soleil, ces grands espaces subissent aujourd’hui de plein fouet le derèglement climatique.

programme.title: Lexperience biosphère : 120 jours dans le desert
programme.desc: Au coeur du desert mexicain, l’ingenieur Corentin de Chatelperron et l’ecodesigneuse Caroline Pultz experimentent une vie en autonomie dans l’habitat low-tech qu’ils ont imagine. Une aventure riche en defis, decouvertes et perspectives d’avenir.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Trois sujets pour decouvrir le Perou : le pays et ses habitants sous loeil d’Irving Penn ; le lac Titicaca, refuge des peuples andins ; le sanctuaire inca du Machu Picchu.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: Soucieux de voir se perpetuer les traditions de l’Église orthodoxe georgienne et de faire vivre le patrimoine culturel de son pays, frère Iakobi s’emploie à preserver la lignee des bergers du Caucase, une race de chiens originaire de la region.

programme.title: Chanter la vie : les Manouches d’Alsace
programme.desc: En Alsace, Tosca et Maya font partie de la communaute manouche. La première, âgee de 18 ans, est elève au conservatoire de Strasbourg et croise les traditions musicales tsiganes et sa passion pour lopera. Sa cousine Maya, la trentaine, est aveugle depuis ladolescence. Accordeuse de piano, elle dirige une chorale qui mele voyants et non-voyants, et a cree la première equipe feminine de cecifoot.

programme.title: ARTE Reportage
programme.desc: La guerre de Gaza divise de plus en plus la societe israelienne qui oscille entre cessez-le-feu et annexion / Filmees clandestinement, de jeunes Afghanes temoignent de leur vie recluse sous la loi des talibans.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: 28 minutes samedi
programme.desc: Retour sur lactualite internationale : laccord de cessez-le-feu à Gaza ; les engagements de Robert Badinter ; le ministre de lInterieur britannique veut restreindre les manifestations de soutien à la Palestine ; le president argentin, Javier Milei, donne un concert de rock en marge d’un meeting politique ; le syndrôme de lindecision.

programme.title: Terre, les forces du vivant
programme.desc: De la creation de la Terre, il y a environ 4,5 milliards dannees, au present incertain de lanthropocène, cette odyssee geologique retrace avec de fabuleuses images les interactions meconnues entre le monde mineral et le vivant.

programme.title: Darwin express
programme.desc: Du bush australien aux rives des grands lacs canadiens en passant par les prairies françaises, les dernières decouvertes des biologistes rebattent les cartes de la science de l’evolution.

programme.title: Orques de Gibraltar : detranges attaques
programme.desc: Lannee 2020 a vu naître un etrange phenomène : au large de lAtlantique, entre le golfe de Gascogne et le detroit de Gibraltar, plusieurs voiliers ont ete pris pour cible par des orques. Depuis, ces attaques nont cesse de se multiplier, provoquant la terreur des navigateurs. Comment expliquer ce comportement des epaulards ?

programme.title: Court-circuit
programme.desc: Plusieurs pepites du cinema danimation : "Croak Show" de Suresh Eriyat, "Fille de leau" de Sandra Desmazières, "Une fugue" d’Agnès Patron, "Un conte très tordu" de Catherine Buffat et Jean-Luc Greco, "La voix des sirènes" de Gianluigi Toccafondo, et "La saison pourpre" de Clemence Bouchereau - Entretien avec Felix Dufour-Laperrière, realisateur de "La mort nexiste pas".

programme.title: Panique au village : les grandes vacances
programme.desc: Indien et Cowboy s’ennuient ferme. Et s’ils construisaient un bateau de pirates pour aller naviguer sur le lac ? Le dernier-ne des courts metrages de la saga "Panique au village", des Belges Stephane Aubier et Vincent Patar. Un regal.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: La musique peut nous rendre euphoriques ou melancoliques. Meme les nourrissons se mettent à fretiller au rythme d’une comptine. Alors, quels mecanismes sont à l’œuvre quand nous eprouvons l’envie irrepressible de nous tremousser ? Longtemps cantonnee à la philosophie, cette question est desormais etudiee par les scientifiques, qui observent les neurones des musiciens et melomanes par imagerie cerebrale.

programme.title: Les artisans du bon pain
programme.desc: Après des etudes de philosophie, de pedagogie et de menuiserie, Jean-Jacques devient chauffeur de bus en Georgie. Ce Français originaire de Bretagne tombe amoureux du pays et de son pain. Il s’interesse au ble et aux techniques de confection, puis ouvre sa propre boulangerie à Tbilissi, la capitale.

programme.title: Les artisans du bon pain
programme.desc: Voilà vingt-cinq ans, Nicolas quitte Paris pour un village de Bretagne où il decide de fabriquer du pain. Le ble provient de sa propre ferme, autour de laquelle s’etendent des champs où cohabitent cereales, pois et haricots. Le boulanger travaille avec du gros sel et de la fleur de sel de Bourgneuf-sur-Retz que lui envoie un ami.

programme.title: Les artisans du bon pain
programme.desc: Après avoir parcouru l’Autriche, l’Italie et l’Allemagne, Arnd retrouve sa region natale, la Franconie, où il reprend les renes de la boulangerie familiale, ouverte depuis plus de trois siècles. Progressivement, il se tourne vers des produits locaux et biologiques et se passionne pour le levain naturel. Arnd mise aujourd’hui sur une clientèle de proximite pour faire vivre son commerce.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Aujourdhui, le feu est devenu synonyme de destruction, avec des incendies de plus en plus ravageurs emettant denormes quantites de CO2. De quoi accelerer le derèglement climatique qui, à son tour, favorise les departs de feu. Un cercle vicieux qui a pousse les chercheurs à qualifier notre epoque de "pyrocène".

programme.title: Les energies de la mer, toujours en lice ?
programme.desc: Parviendrons-nous un jour à produire de l’electricite à grande echelle en utilisant la puissance des oceans ? Un etat des lieux des echecs et des percees novatrices en la matière.

programme.title: Les vagues scelerates, un mystère de taille
programme.desc: En haute mer, enquete sur les vagues scelerates. Cauchemar de tous les marins, elles peuvent atteindre la taille dun immeuble de dix etages, soit près de 35 mètres de haut. Veritables murs deau surgissant de nulle part, elles menacent meme les bateaux les plus modernes.

programme.title: ARTE Junior, le mag
programme.desc: Notre dossier ecole de la semaine sinteresse à legalite entre les filles et les garçons. Les traite-t-on de la meme manière, partout dans le monde ? Cest lune des questions de la classe de 6e2 du collège Sophie Germain de Strasbourg à loccasion de la journee internationale de la fille le 11 octobre.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Sur les reseaux sociaux, chacun y va de sa petite recette du bonheur et de la vie saine. Une recherche de perfection qui vire parfois à l’obsession. Le developpement personnel est-il la garantie de la reussite ? Cette quete d’absolu ne nous prive-t-elle pas de l’essentiel ?

programme.title: Construire des visions
programme.desc: Cap sur des concepts architecturaux novateurs hautement adaptables. Dans cet episode : La Nouvelle-Orleans. L’architecte Jonathan Tates et son equipe conçoivent des habitations pour des veterans traumatises, d’anciens prisonniers ou encore des primo-accedants disposant dun faible capital.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: Quelles sont les causes de la depression, ce mal dont personne n’est à l’abri ? Comment lui faire face et retrouver l’equilibre ? "Twist" donne la parole à des artistes concernes par ce trouble psychique pour briser le silence et aider les autres à se sentir moins seuls.

programme.title: Dans le sud de la Toscane
programme.desc: La Toscane attire des visiteurs du monde entier, qui se pressent au nord, à Florence et à Pise, ou dans la region viticole du Chianti. Le sud de cette region recèle aussi des joyaux plus confidentiels. Son authenticite transparaît dans ses paysages encore sauvages, en meme temps que chez ses habitants vaillants et pleins dune joie de vivre tout italienne.

programme.title: Les delices d’Émilie-Romagne
programme.desc: Un delicieux voyage à la croisee des traditions culinaires du nord de lItalie. Cette etape nous emmène de Parme à Bologne, en passant par Modène. Au menu : des tortellini à la mortadelle et au jambon de parme, du porc agremente d’une sauce aigre-douce aux cerises, et un gâteau confectionne à partir de genoise à la farine de châtaigne et au chocolat.

programme.title: L’archipel d’Hawaï
programme.desc: L’île dHawaï, aussi appelee "Big Island", est la plus etendue de l’archipel du meme nom. Le volcan qu’elle abrite, le Kilauea, est très actif ; autour du cratère, quelques rares promeneurs profitent de paysages grandioses, à l’instar de la New-Yorkaise Jade Chen.

programme.title: L’archipel d’Hawaï
programme.desc: Situees au centre de l’archipel, les îles Maui et Molokai ont des attraits bien distincts. La première est très prisee des surfeurs : Archie Kalepa y savoure les grosses vagues depuis de nombreuses annees. La musique et la danse de l’île sont egalement très reputees. La deuxième île, Molokai, est bien plus calme : avec un seul et unique hôtel, elle a ete très preservee du tourisme.

programme.title: Larchipel dHawaï
programme.desc: La troisième plus grande île de l’archipel, Oahu, abrite Honolulu, la capitale de ce qui est aussi le 50e État americain. Situee sur la côte sud, elle est particulièrement reputee pour son quartier de Waikiki, separe du reste de la ville par un canal, qui compte un port et une plage paradisiaque.

programme.title: Quand lhistoire fait dates
programme.desc: En 212 de notre ère, la loi imperiale dite edit de Caracalla elargit la citoyennete romaine à tous les habitants libres de lEmpire. C’est une loi fondamentale de l’Empire romain tardif, qui pose les principes fondamentaux d’identite et de citoyennete. Que raconte cet evenement sur la Rome du IIIe siècle ? Avec Audrey Bertrand.

programme.title: Le prestige
programme.desc: Londres en 1878. Rupert Angier et Alfred Borden sont deux magiciens surdoues, promis dès leur plus jeune âge à un glorieux avenir. Une competition amicale les oppose dabord lun à lautre, mais lemulation tourne vite à la jalousie, puis à la haine. Devenus de farouches ennemis, les deux rivaux vont sefforcer de se detruire lun lautre en usant des plus noirs secrets de leur art. Cette obsession aura pour leur entourage des consequences dramatiques.

programme.title: Une histoire mondiale de la navigation
programme.desc: Depuis quand les humains sillonnent-ils les mers ? Une retrospective de l’histoire de la navigation, de l’Antiquite jusqu’à la mise à leau des premiers paquebots, illustree par dimpressionnantes archives.

programme.title: Des animaux et des arbres
programme.desc: Traversee dimages spectaculaires, cette immersion dans la foret gaspesienne, au Canada, revèle les liens etonnants quentretiennent les arbres et les animaux.

programme.title: Concert de lOpera de Vienne - Elīna Garanca, Benjamin Bernheim, Jonas Kaufmann
programme.desc: Top depart pour la saison 2025 de lOpera de Vienne ! En plein air, dans le joyau vert du Burggarten, le maestro Bertrand de Billy dirige des voix hors pair (Camilla Nylund, Elina Garanca, Jonas Kaufmann, Benjamin Bernheim et Boris Pinkhasovich) sur des airs de Puccini, Gounod, Bizet ou encore Wagner.

programme.title: Karambolage
programme.desc: Les Français – comme les Allemands - aiment s’asperger d’eau de Cologne. Mais pourquoi l’eau de Cologne s’appelle-t-elle "eau de Cologne" ? - Michel Souris nous propose une petite sortie culturelle au Louvre à la (re)decouverte de la Joconde.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: Camille Claudel, sculpter pour exister
programme.desc: Une exploration sensible de la trajectoire de la sculptrice Camille Claudel (1864-1943), qui accorde une place particulière aux rapports qu’elle entretint avec ses consoeurs.

programme.title: Les noces rebelles
programme.desc: Dans lAmerique des annees 50, Frank et April Wheeler se considèrent comme des etres à part, des gens speciaux, differents des autres. Ils ont toujours voulu fonder leur existence sur des ideaux eleves. Lorsquils emmenagent dans leur nouvelle maison sur Revolutionary Road, ils proclament fièrement leur independance. Jamais ils ne se conformeront à linertie banlieusarde qui les entoure, jamais ils ne se feront pieger par les conventions sociales.

programme.title: Kate Winslet, resolument actrice
programme.desc: Confrontee dès son plus jeune âge au diktat de la minceur, Kate Winslet dessine un parcours à sa façon, en choisissant dincarner des femmes authentiques, à la psyche complexe et au corps realiste, montrant une resolution sans faille dans ses choix dinterpretation.

programme.title: Hotel Metamorphosis - Festival de Salzbourg 2025
programme.desc: Quand les "Metamorphoses" dOvide rencontrent la musique de Vivaldi : conçu et mis en scène par Barrie Kosky, un spectacle effervescent presente au Festival de Salzbourg 2025. Avec Cecilia Bartoli, Lea Desandre, Nadezhda Karyazina et Philippe Jaroussky, ainsi que lactrice Angela Winkler dans le rôle parle dOrphee.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Taylor Swift, Cillian Murphy, Greta Lee, Jodie Turner-Smith and Domhnall Gleeson join Graham on his sofa. And theres live music from Scottish great Lewis Capaldi.

programme.title: The Weakest Link Celebrity Specials
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts the general knowledge quiz where eight celebrities are put to the test as they compete to win up to £50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman. Four teams of two contestants attempt to find correct answers to four rounds of general knowledge questions, with the winning team eligible to compete for the shows cash jackpot.

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Sarah, Charlotte, Tamara and Iulia take on the Bridge of Lies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Join Sandi Toksvig and pannelists Stephen K Amos, Ivo Graham, Holly Walsh and Alan Davies for silly season at QI.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team of experts make a return visit to Hanbury Hall near Droitwich in Worcestershire, where it seems that extraordinarily large objects are the talking point of the day.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Location, Location, Location with guests Jason Manford, Aisling Bea, Johnny Vegas and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Literature with guests Victoria Coren Mitchell, Jack Whitehall, Lloyd Langford and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Levity with guests Josh Widdicombe, Sue Perkins, Frank Skinner and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lenses with guests Jo Brand, Josh Widdicombe, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks through a list of L-themed larks - a liblabble, as he calls it. With The Reverend Richard Coles, Sara Pascoe, Bill Bailey and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the quite interesting side of all things lethal, with a deadly and dangerous panel of Bill Bailey, Sandi Toksvig, Jason Manford and Alan Davies. Topics covered include the hazards of laptop batteries and sugar-free sweets.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lovely with guests Josh Widdicombe, Aisling Bea, Tony Hawks and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Ladies and Gents with guests Ross Noble, Kathy Lette, Sue Perkins and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Where the Wild Men Are with Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben meets a former carpenter living on a private island in Iceland

programme.title: Where the Wild Men Are with Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben Fogle journeys to the mountains of central Portugal.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With only six bakers left in the tent, the stakes increase as they face the pastry round. The remaining bakers bring the old fashioned suet pudding bang up to date.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the quarter-final and Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood test how the five remaining contestants cope with unconventional flours and unusual desserts, beginning by baking a signature loaf using non-traditional flours such as spelt, rye, potato and tapioca. In the technical challenge they each have to prepare a gluten-free dacquoise, which is made with meringue, coffee custard and hazelnut praline, before creating dairy-free novelty vegetable cakes for the showstopper round. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A draft script of a classic film and some very important dolls are among the finds when the team visit Tewkesbury Abbey in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Audley End, Essex, where experts value a sword that played an important role in the end of the American War of Independence, a collection of toilet chains and a silver container that once contained a goats gallstone believed to have magical powers. The biggest shock of the day comes when Eric Knowles reveals the worth of a set of three vases decorated with fairies.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Saint Marie welcomes a new DI but the Caribbean island isnt exactly his idea of paradise. Jacks romance with Anna blossoms while he and the rest of the team investigate the mysterious death of a cyclist during a race.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Saint Marie welcomes a new DI but the Caribbean island isnt exactly his idea of paradise. Jack faces a life-changing decision whilst investigating the murder of a man found dead in a boat off the Saint Marie coast.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The celebratory launch of a new luxury resort is cut short when a woman is found electrocuted in her hotel bathtub - with the door locked from the inside. It looks like a simple case of suicide, but with Jack Mooney no longer around to confirm Commissioner Selwyns suspicions, DI Neville Parker is temporarily flown over from Manchester to close the case. However, he soon realises that island life is not for him, so when evidence of suspicious activity turns up, he is dismayed to realise he will have to extend his stay and investigate the case as murder.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In...
programme.desc: Richard and comedian Joe Lycett head to the mini break mecca of Amsterdam, for some culture, cardio, canals, cuisine, drawing, Dutch gin, and the museum of street organs.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In...
programme.desc: Richard and actor Sally Phillips have a fulsome time with fika, meatballs, scaling high rooftops, singing Abba, and staying up late playing on their phones.

programme.title: The Weakest Link Celebrity Specials
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts the general knowledge quiz where eight celebrities are put to the test as they compete to win up to £50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Taylor Swift, Cillian Murphy, Greta Lee, Jodie Turner-Smith and Domhnall Gleeson join Graham on his sofa. And theres live music from Scottish great Lewis Capaldi.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: With guests Shirley Ballas, Steven Bartlett, Josie Gibson and Chris McCausland.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: The brilliant Ed Gamble introduces comedians Tom Davis and Judi Love to the stage.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return to the Wild
programme.desc: Ben makes an unprecedented third visit to see his old friends Bill and Bob, elderly twins living in the canyons of Utah, and realises that their paranoia about the outside world has grown.

programme.title: Scandinavia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The second leg of Simons journey takes him from the beautiful fjords of Norway across the North Atlantic to Iceland, the original land fire and ice. Its a world of extremes and contradictions.

programme.title: Where the Wild Men Are with Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben embarks on an epic journey to meet one of the most remote families hes encountered, uncovering what drove academics and married couple Bec and Reece to leave civilisation for complete isolation.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Location, Location, Location with guests Jason Manford, Aisling Bea, Johnny Vegas and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Literature with guests Victoria Coren Mitchell, Jack Whitehall, Lloyd Langford and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Levity with guests Josh Widdicombe, Sue Perkins, Frank Skinner and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on Lenses with guests Jo Brand, Josh Widdicombe, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks through a list of L-themed larks - a liblabble, as he calls it. With The Reverend Richard Coles, Sara Pascoe, Bill Bailey and Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the quite interesting side of all things lethal, with a deadly and dangerous panel of Bill Bailey, Sandi Toksvig, Jason Manford and Alan Davies. Topics covered include the hazards of laptop batteries and sugar-free sweets.

programme.title: The Weakest Link Celebrity Specials
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts the general knowledge quiz where eight celebrities are put to the test as they compete to win up to £50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In...
programme.desc: Richard and Lena Dunham fast forward through Tenerife, with a visit to a volcano, some stargazing, a sculpture tour, layered coffee, a spot of golf, and a whale hunt.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by coming up with the answers that no-one else can think of.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by coming up with the answers that no-one else can think of.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the quite interesting side of all things lethal, with a deadly and dangerous panel of Bill Bailey, Sandi Toksvig, Jason Manford and Alan Davies. Topics covered include the hazards of laptop batteries and sugar-free sweets.

programme.title: QI

However, he soon realises that island life is not for him, so when evidence of suspicious activity turns up, he is dismayed to realise he will have to extend his stay and investigate the case as murder.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Sr. is having some work done on the shop, and in return, hes building bikes for the contracted companies, DECA and Col-Met. Everyone at OCC is trying to adjust to life in the shop without Paul Jr.

programme.title: The Autobahn A2
programme.desc: One of Europes busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people its their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.desc: Steve Dulcich returns along with the Vanishing Paint Challenger. Derek and Steve switch out the gearbox and go to a local road course.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek goes off the deep end with an 80s icon, the DeLorean. Its been wrecked and doesnt run, but Derek and his friends change all that with a good old junkyard LS.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Furniture restorer Steve Norman rescues a rare and valuable campaign desk. Ted Edley transforms a broken 1960s pedal car into a sporty racer with pace and grace.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Natasha tasks Ted and Ruth with transforming a French Lily Chandelier; Martin gets to work on Drews Victorian fire bucket; and Saxon hands over a gargantuan estate wardrobe to Robin Johnson.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpack struggles to bring their 50-year-old mining equipment back to life, while Rain makes an emotional return to resume her role as Brown mine boss, in hopes of fulfilling the Browns dream of striking gold.

programme.title: 100 Days Wild
programme.desc: Jennifer and Andrew welcome new members to their nomadic community. How will they adapt to a hunter-gatherer life in Alaskas Tanana Valley?

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The pressure is on for the miners, as a slow start to the season is compounded by a host of mechanical problems. Tony continues to make life difficult for Parker.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: Rick hunts for a new wash plant with his crew. Parker must find a way to mine the gold to pay his deposit to Tony. Meanwhile, Tony orders his son to train up a new dredgemaster, but a vital piece of equipment is damaged.

programme.title: Abalone Wars
programme.desc: In Port Lincoln the abalone crews take advantage of a break in the weather to seize their share of this $35bn trade. But will the tight time line force them to take stupid risks?

programme.desc: In remote jungles, Josh explores one of the 20th centurys biggest heists: the looting of Cambodian statues. He descends into a crumbling pyramid.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid
programme.desc: A hunter from Louisiana meets a California surfer girl on a deserted island of the Philippines. With very little water to tap into, dehydration soon sets in.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid

programme.title: Botched
programme.desc: Famed plastic surgeons Dr Terry Dubrow and Dr Paul Nassif do what they can to support clients who have suffered a range of plastic surgery disasters. In this third season, they meet people with all kinds of needs, from a woman whose nipples are too high to an ex-Playboy model who wants a second chance at fixing her nose and body. They also support an out of this world patient who wants to look like an alien, a woman who wants to like a pixie, and a reality star who wants the doctors to make her look "plastic fantastic". These are just some of the people that Terry and Paul come across as they try to remedy plastic surgeries that have gone wrong, but expect to see many more as they work with clients across the United States. Some cases are challenging and some are downright outrageous, but with their special brand of skills, the celebrated doctors at the heart of this American reality series work hard to restore both the looks and the self-confidence of their struggling patients.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Is it only a matter of time before an asteroid hits Earth and wipes out human civilisation?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts contemplate whether aliens could be causing natural disasters and wars in a bid to control the fate of the human race.

programme.title: Breaking Mysterious
programme.desc: A secret serviceman for President Kennedy sheds light on a plot to assassinate JFK on the streets of Chicago, and a treasure hunter may have located Arizonas infamous Lost Dutchman Mine. Plus, could New England be a new Bigfoot hotspot?

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Zahi makes it clear to the world community that every important Egyptian artefact must be returned to Egypt, and so a missing piece of an offering table is headed back to Karnak Temple from New Yorks Metropolitan Museum of Art.

programme.title: Engineering An Empire
programme.desc: Exploring the architecture and infrastructure engineered by the ancient Greeks during the time of Alexander the Great.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: Peter meets with a man who warns of the deathly risks of searching for Yamashitas treasure, and a connection to the CIA, as the team moves mountains to clear the last obstacles and finds a secret tunnel directly into the mountain.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: The history of eyewitness accounts of a 50-foot monster known as Ogopogo sighted in Lake Okanagan in British Columbia, Canada.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: Before WWII was lost, Hitler planned a new Germany full of architectural wonders. Discover the world we could have been living in if the war had gone differently.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Shipwreck Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross first takes on the largest wrecks in Scapa Flow: Germany’s sunken WWI fleet. Ross tries to understand why the proud German fleet ended up at the bottom. The trail leads to an experimental British aircraft carrier submarine.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: New York is one of the most man-made spaces on the planet, but everything from the height of its skyscrapers to the position of its harbour is governed by extraordinary forces.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: The most shocking missing item of all: the iconic Ground Zero Flag, raised by firefighters on 9/11. A few hours after it was raised, this sacred relic simply disappeared.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The architecture in Washington DC was inspired by the ancient world. But is it possible that the designs and philosophies enshrined in the streets of the US capital were influenced by an otherworldly source?

programme.title: The Search For The Tesla Files
programme.desc: Marc, Jason and Travis follow the trail back to New York where they discover traces of a shadow government bent on keeping Nikola Teslas files secret.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: A top-secret Nazi project - "Die Glocke," was believed to be a time travel device that could soar through the sky and eventually reach the speed of light and beyond. Did Die Glocke actually exist, and could it have been based on alien technology?

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Bob and Johns investigation continues in Spain, Morocco and Argentina. The teams look into Hitlers possible escape route while uncovering a plan for a Nazi Fourth Reich.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the theory that Stonehenge may be a prehistoric astronomical observatory. Ancient astronomer priests may have divined the complex movements of the Sun and Moon, recognising patterns that would not be discovered elsewhere.

programme.title: The Hunt For Baltic Gold
programme.desc: The series follows amber hunters on their mission to unearth Baltic Gold. They roam the stormy seaside at night and waddle in the mud during the day. They are present everywhere the 40-million-year-old precious jewel can be found.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: American treasure hunter John Casey returns to the Philippines with a new team and new technology, in a continued effort to solve one of World War IIs greatest mysteries. A satellite scan of the mountain reveals massive metal deposits underground.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Greed, genocide and murder - the likes of Julius Caesar, Genghis Khan, Attila the Hun and Cleopatra stopped at nothing to make sure their names went down in history. Which of these tyrants will be named the number one dictator of the ancient world?

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Reveals for the first time the cockpit and control tower audio recordings of pilot and astronaut confrontations and sightings of unidentified flying objects high in our skies.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: Ancient lore talks of a Canadian warrior tribe that once terrorized the Nahanni valley, decapitating their enemies with scythes. The tribe vanished many years ago, but might have resurfaced in the Alaska Triangle. Missing person reports have coincided with eyewitness sightings of frightening ancient soldiers. Our team investigates the mystery.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: In 479 BC, the Spartans beat the Persians to avenge their defeat at Thermopylae. Discover what it was like to fight in one of historys most tactical and disciplined battles.

programme.title: Food Tech
programme.desc: Host Bobby Bognar explores Italian cuisine across the U.S., sourcing ingredients, pasta secrets in NY, vinegars, wines in CA, and dessert wisdom from NJ to Costa Rica.

programme.desc: During WWII, the Nazi war machine created specialized camps that were only used for one purpose, killing prisoners. At Sobibor, a group of Jews that were forced to keep the camp operational, engineered a mass escape that saved many of their lives.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its the Okido Circus today and Messy is worried about performing his tripple flip. Will his friends be able to help him conquer his tummy flutters before the audience arrives?

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Plum’s plan to direct a small, simple fairytale play as a surprise performance for the Baby Berrykins snowballs out of control when she hears of the same play being done on a grand scale in Berry Big City. Not listening to Strawberry’s advice to keep it simple, she becomes convinced that unless her production is as big, she’ll be the laughing stock of the berry bitty theatrical world! Casting the girls and Berrykins as stage stars in a sendup of “Snow White and the Seven Dwarves,” Plum attempts to match the spectacular stage effects of a big city theater.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: A preschool boy named Harry receives a bucket full of toy dinosaurs. This bucket holds a secret --- by using its power, Harry can travel with his dinosaurs to an amazing land of imagination called Dino World.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry thinks his delicious cookie has been stolen he goes to Dino-World where he plays at being a detective searching for the thief.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a baby plantain squirrel eating his seed collection. The Junior Rangers drive to the forest to locate the squirrel’s nest and mother.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Gordon is late to pull the Express the Fat Controller gives it to Henry instead. Because Gordon has said how difficult his work is, Henry doubts he’s up to the job but more than proves himself and all the passengers love him. Gordon is left to take over Henry’s work, which he thinks is beneath him, and he ends up going on strike. The Fat Controller insists Gordon pulls the Flying Kipper as penance but Gordon refuses till Henry makes Gordon think the job is too hard for him, spurring Gordon to prove Henry wrong

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel always likes to appear rough and tough in front of Arry and Bert. But when Thomas, unexpectedly, finds him lovingly fussing over some baby ducklings he threatens to tell everyone that Diesel is just a big softie. Diesel is horrified and promises to be nice to everyone in exchange for Thomas not telling anyone about the ducklings. All the engines are pleasantly surprised when Diesel starts being polite and friendly, but just how long can he keep it up?

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A rare bird, the Picking Bird, is in the forest for a very short time, and Dr. Natureza wants to be the first to take a photo. But she caught a terrible cold, so it will be up to Grisù to help her as a wildlife photographer. Exploring the forest is an exciting adventure for Grisù and Stella, but the mysterious bird isn’t easy to spot. Plus Fume, who’s searching ingredients for a dragon recipe, unintentionally messes up with Grisù’s mission. In the end, however, Grisù understands that the bird is attracted by sparkling stuff. So he comes up with an inventive way to take the perfect picture just before sunset.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to babysit and feed a little sea lion while Dr. Natureza is healing its mother. They must prevent the cub from reaching the sea and get lost, but the baby is pretty lively and the mission is not so easy. When the sea lion goes missing, a quest begins. Eventually, the little dragon realizes that the sea lions are very sociable animals, and they love to play, so he will create an improvised fun fair to get the cub back, avoiding other getaways.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The badger-foxes have to quickly organize the forest dance. This mainly consists of starting off the dancing. Edmund does not know how to dance and tries to find ways of getting around this problem. The children will do everything they can to help him so that Margaret, who loves dancing, will not be disappointed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a solar panel demonstration, Mayor Madison decrees that the Sea Life Center will be entirely powered by renewable energy. Bob and the team must build a wind farm, which excites Scoop - he cant wait to see the spinny things going round. As they begin construction, Mr Bentley arrives and pulls Bob away, enthusing about other renewable energy schemes they have planned. Spring City will need more energy as it grows, so they need to think ahead. Scoop decides he should think ahead like Mr Bentley suggests, and convinces Lofty to move some of the turbines closer together.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob announces there’s been a Spring City Clock Competition to design the new Spring City Clock – and guess who’s won? The Spring City Rockets! Bob shows the Machines their winning design and explains that metal figures will emerge and sound the bells on the clock. Wendy has been welding the metal figures together. Leo arrives and is looking forward to helping Bob with the decorative cladding around the clock tower but Bob tells him it’s Recycling Day today and his job is to take all the recycling to the Centre first. Bob and the Machines set off to the site while Leo and Muck gather up the boxes of recycling from around the Yard. But Leo is in such a hurry that he mistakes the box with the metal figures in for recycling and dumps it at the Recycling Centre.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A yellow-crested cockatoo joins Leo and Hero’s game of musical statues. After learning more about the bird, the Junior Rangers travel to the rainforest to take it home.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Katie finds out that a big fish in the garden pond is a whitespotted bamboo shark. The Junior Rangers sail to the Pacific Ocean to find a coral reef for the bamboo shark to live in.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s Gaspard’s birthday. Simon has found out where Mommy has hidden his brother’s present. But Simon has sworn he’ll keep it a secret! Still, he can’t stop himself from arousing Gaspard’s curiosity. His little brother finally understands that the present is hidden somewhere in the house. He starts looking everywhere! Simon is getting worried. So that Gaspard won’t find it, Simon changes hiding places at the last split second. But the big surprise is for Mommy when she finds the present has disappeared! Ah, but Simon knows where it is and even more important, he’s been able to keep it a secret!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda wants to open a hotel so that people from far afield can spend time in beautiful Wild Rose Lane. Rupert thinks its a bad idea, but Tilda sticks to her guns. Then the first guests arrive at Hotel Appleseed, a frog and his son. But instead of being quiet and polite, the guests turn Tildas house on its head. Soon she is rushed off her feet with work.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, a mouse called Ferdinand Pearstalk turns up on Tildas doorstep and announces that he will be taking over her house: the vicar has swapped churches and with him the church mouse. To Tildas amazement, he immediately moves in. With a heavy heart, Tilda puts all her stuff on a handcart and trundles off.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert teaches the kids how to find one’s way through the forest. But as they search their way home, Rupert falls asleep. The kids follow their tracks and also help Rupert find his way back.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. Little Nutbrown Hare is surprised that Big Nutbrown Hare knows every single creature in the meadow. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: This badge is a little different. The trainees must award this badge to someone they appreciate. Brewster finds it difficult, as he appreciates so many of his friends for so many different reasons. In the end, he decides to award it Vee, who always keeps an eye out for him, encourages him to do his best - and keeps Chuggington running like clockwork!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Junior Ranger Zari is on a forest patrol in the Malaysian Forest when she later discovers an adorable Asian baby elephant. She contacts her fellow Junior Rangers Leo and Katie to ask for some help. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie were filling up an inflatable pool with water. They were interrupted when Leo receives a call from Zari, asking help on the baby elephant. After learning more about Asian elephants through Katies tablet and realize that the baby elephant must have been separated from its herd, they set off on a mission to reunite the baby elephant with its mother. When the Junior Ranger arrives, they see that baby elephant was cheerful beside Zari. Katie pulls up her tablet to see the closest river when they can go to meet the mother. After a while, the baby elephant sees a mud puddle and happily runs and lies in it. Then Ranger Rocky appears as he was nearby, introducing himself. The baby elephant sees Ranger Rocky and playfully cuddle from the baby elephant as it approaches him. Unable to free Ranger Rocky from the elephants weight, they come up with a clever plan using a branch as a snack to lure the baby elephant away.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the dense Borneo forest, Farah faces a daunting challenge as she attempts to conquer a fallen tree trunk. With determination and strength, she overcomes the obstacle, celebrating a fleeting triumph. However, her moment of victory quickly transforms into an unexpected stumble when a mischievous tree root thwarts her progress, sending her crashing to the ground. As Farah lifts her head, her gaze is met with a sight that stirs her empathy—a distressed animal in need of assistance. Filled with concern, she extends her hand to aid the creature, only to be met with a sharp snap, forcing her to retreat. Meanwhile, in a different setting, Leo and Katie cautiously approach their canine companion, Hero, who is blissfully engrossed in chewing his bone. Intriguingly, they inform Hero of a promised reward, but with a peculiar condition—he must don a blindfold. Intrigued and trusting, Hero agrees, and Leo skillfully secures the blindfold around his loyal friend, while Katie lifts him up. Together, they embark on an adventure that leads them to a bathtub filled with frothy bubbles, aiming to fulfill the enigmatic reward. However, a slight misstep by Leo, unintentionally triggering a rubber duckie, shatters their stealthy approach, alerting Hero to the unusual situation. In an instant, Hero darts away, prompting the Junior Rangers to pursue him relentlessly. Amidst the commotion, Leos phone rings, and he answers to find Farah on the line, urgently requesting their help with a distressed turtle.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are playing in the cottage when a big "boom" startles them. Running out onto the terrace, they find a stunned sparrow: it’s obvious the small bird flew into the window and has gotten a big bump from the collision! Dad insists the animal needs peace and quiet in order to recover. T’choupi and Nina set themselves the mission of tending to the wounded bird. But disruptions in the cottage, such as a fleeing goat and a chasing cat, make their task way more difficult than expected! Will T’choupi and Nina manage to help the sparrow fly again?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi spots a baby rabbit at the edge of the garden. Taking pity on this lone animal, he decides he wants to keep it. So he introduces it to Plume and Plumeau, hoping they’ll all play together. But despite his good intentions, T’choupi realizes before long that you can’t just invite any random guest into your home…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a "special kind of hide And seek," using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic "kookoo" greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley cannot wait to see the circus with his friends! Except that he has misunderstood, it’s actually the circus that is coming to his school! There are workshops with clowns, on juggling and acrobatics… Everyone is having a wonderful time except for Jane who has trouble finding a workshop that suits her…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A butterfly has entered the hall and cant find a way out. Sam and Julia use different strategies to capture the insect and get it back to freedom. But the butterfly doesnt seems to understand.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia found a gift in her mothers closet and she thinks it is hers. With Sams help, our impatient Julia tries to figure out what is in the package but destroy a part of it. How to it back as it was?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Around the World: Sam dreams of travelling the world, so he and Julia turn the Mouse Mansion into a global adventure. (S1, ep 14)

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. She makes several mistakes, and worries she doesn’t fit in with the other engines. Nia encourages Darcy to be herself and she soon makes up for her mistakes when everyone sees what she can really do!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily loves listening to stories of Nias travels - she has been all the way around the world and had some big adventures. It feels like ages since Emily left Sodor to go to the Great Railway Show - and everyones heard that story already. Rebecca can see that Emily is longing for a bit of adventure and so, when Nia is asked to take the Sodor Rangers up to Callan Castle, Rebecca suggests that Emily do the job instead. Emily ends up derailed and lost in the fog. But when Nia comes to the rescue she finds an exciting girls-together campsite! Emily and Nia camp out all night with the Sodor Rangers! The two friends return in the morning with an exciting story to tell!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Daddy play a VR video game in an arcade, as Caillou tries to win a Robot toy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends all try and stay awake until midnight on New Year’s Eve.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkeys enormous pile of coconuts falls into parrot’s hammock and rips it. Monkey looks for a needle to fix it. Mole suggests going to Hedgehog, whose back is covered with prickly needle like spines. They fly off to the forest and meet the shy hedgehog who gives them a needle and plays a game of Monkey See Monkey Do with them.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy and Sarah are making a film comparing what dogs and cats are good at, and the cats are clearly doing better than dogs, even at fetch! But soon a kitchen fire gives Nipper the dog a chance to save the day.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At a picnic on Annies farm, Peter comes up with a series of games that almost lead to disaster! Meanwhile, Lizzie and Jodie search for a rare seal.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin struggles with making the “perfect” sculpture for Aunt T’s found-object sculpture garden -- until he learns to “see” his, and everyone else’s, sculpture in a different light. /When Franklin and Bear - not cooperating well - lose a badminton doubles challenge and are forced to walk around three-legged style for an entire day, they have no choice but to finally learn how to really work together as a team.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox has brought some elderberries for the children. Unknown to the others, Edmund swallows one and then learns that the number had been calculated so that each child received the same amount of berries. Edmund slips away to find another elderberry. Meanwhile, the children share out the berries and find that there are three left over. What should they do ? There seems to be no simple solution…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky invented a song for the islands great singing competition that evening! But he needs a musician to accompany him and has not found anyone... Doodleboo will help him, thanks to a Riddleboo! And he is sure that what his friend needs is a very good castanets player!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to organize a football tournament but he does not know how to do it... Doodleboo surely has an idea of Riddleboo to help him.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is looking for the perfect gift for Mothers Day! He can count on Doodleboo to have a good idea...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave listen out for some very strange noises in Hatty’s garden. Who or what is making the ‘Bang-Bang, Ting-ting-a-ling and Ratta-tat-tat’ sounds and will Dave’s ‘Blue Panda Idea,’ stop them from keeping Hatty awake at night?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Mr and Mrs Rabbit and the three Little Bunnies move to a new burrow. But Littlest Bunny doesn’t want to go; and keeping track of all the bunnies’ belongings turns out to be hard work. Tweet has to reassure Littlest Bunny that his favourite cuddly carrot toy will be delivered safely and that he will love his new home.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Winter snow is softening in the meadow and Big Nutbrown Hare finds some beautiful flowers peeking through the snow, a sure sign that Spring is finally on its way. With the help of his friends Little Nutbrown Hares comes up with a very special and unique treat!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
