programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When a new nameplate is about to be placed on the statue of Admiral Hornblast, it suddenly disappears. Huckle, Sally and Lowly check out the photos and videos taken at the scene and ultimately determine that the statue slide over the plate when it was bumped by an out of control bulldozer./Pig Will and Pig Won’t are playing spies. However Pig Won’t suddenly finds himself out of the game when his Secret Spy Ring disappears!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey cant seem to slow down. Mole then appears and tells them about the snail who is known for being very slow. Parrot immediately suggests they go to the Meadow. They come across a snail shell which Monkey at first mistakes for a pebble and want to throw into the water, luckily the snail stops him. Soon they are all playing a slow-mo version of Monkey See Monkey Do.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: During a search and rescue drill on Annie’s Farm, Penny and Annie’s childhood rivalry leads to a heated game of hide and seek, a runaway horse, and a river rescue on board Hydrus and Phoenix.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy leads a whirlwind tour of the Seven Wonders of Pontypandy, but her haste to make it to all seven leads to a fire at her campsite!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger and Pig decide to have a race. The prize is one of Pig’s chocolate cakes. Tiger goes on his tricycle and ends up in the duck pond but Kipper keeps running. Arnold gets a lift with Jake on his scooter. Guess who gets the chocolate cake?

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig leaves Arnold with Kipper and wobbles off on his bicycle. Kipper lends Arnold his first bike and, with the help of stabilisers, they have a wonderful ride round Big Hill. Pig can’t believe its Arnold hurtling towards him on his return – a better bike rider than Pig will ever be.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today is "picnic in the forest day!" And T’choupi and his friends are going to be riding there on their bicycles. Yay, how exciting!... Except, for some reason, Nina doesn’t seem too enthusiastic about it… That’s strange – what could possibly be the matter?: she loves going to the forest and is always up for adventure! She agrees to go in the end, albeit reluctantly. But before long, T’choupi discovers her "shameful secret…"

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Friends Day: Sam overhears Julia talking to her best friend. He thought it was him?! Worried, Sam decides to investigate. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam is convinced that Julia admires her older brother Dan more than him. He tries to change his behavior and personality to get a better image. But does Julia really want him to change?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly’s wool that she just bought disappeared! She’s sure that it must have been stolen, so Tilda and Rupert found the Appleseed Detective Agency. Are the friends going to catch the burglar?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mommy has a great news for the Triplet’s, Mrs Bun, Nini’s mom, is going to have a baby ! The Triplets are super excited but Mommy warns them, Nini may not be so happy about it because it’s not always easy to accept a new baby at home. And indeed, when Eliott and The Triplets arrive at the bakery, Nini is very sad, she doesn’t want this new baby. Mrs Bun, who needs to go to the doctor, gives the key of the shop to Eliott and the children and they are going to do everything that’s possible to make Nini smiles and they’re gonna prove her to have siblings is really really fun !

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: We’re at home with the Triplets and it’s practically time to go to bed, our three children are quietly watching TV, a documentary about firemen which passionates Turbulent. But Girl and Poet are not really happy about it, they’d rather watch a fairytail or a documentary about animals. Next, we have a quarrel for the remote control. After all, the zapper is a magical wand which does whatever you want. But these squabbles drives Mommy crazy and she takes the remote away! When you don’t have a zapper anymore, you just have to make your own TV: the Triplet’s TV!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As Woodsy is going to sleep over at Loudo’s, there is a spare place in the burrow. Rosie wants to invite Biva but Scoutbadger wants to invite Martis. Edmund, who does not like it when things get too boisterous, says only one friend can come. Scoutbadger and Rosie quarrel over which one can invite their best friend…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends learn about Vikings at school, and then have a Viking imagination adventure at break time.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou wakes up with an itchy rash. Hes supposed to go and see grandma today, but doesnt want to make her sick, so needs to figure out where it came from.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: On match days Thomas is a very popular engine, because the Sodor football team wear blue. One match day a mainland team come to the island wearing red, and they cheer James because he is red too. Soon the two engines are competing with each other over who can bring the fans to the match faster. But by refusing to pick up supporters wearing the wrong colours, James ends up leaving the rival football team at the station since they are not yet wearing their kit and Thomas rushes right past the Fat Controller who is supposed to be the match referee. In all the confusion and delay there might not be a match at all!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko wishes she were faster - she’s nowhere near as fast as Hanzo. She’s not even as fast as Payce, the new Tootington Tunnel Runner. Koko would love to be a tunnel runner someday. She’s determined to get her speed up and she tries again and again while Hanzo shows Payce around Chuggington. But it’s no good - she can’t do a lap any faster than 9 clickety - clacks. Koko is so disappointed. But when Payce sees the time, she is amazed.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster and Cormac transport a wide, circular tunnel entrance that the chuggineers need in order to finish the high - speed link to Tootington. It spans two tracks and is an awkward load - and when they misjudge a bend, it rolls off. Brewster is devastated; the chuggineers won’t be able to finish the tunnel now! But he doesn’t give up.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley cannot wait to see the circus with his friends! Except that he has misunderstood, it’s actually the circus that is coming to his school! There are workshops with clowns, on juggling and acrobatics… Everyone is having a wonderful time except for Jane who has trouble finding a workshop that suits her…

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave build a playhouse for some rabbits. They have fun with shaped building blocks and discover that by working as a team they can achieve great things.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out playing in the forest, T’choupi and Nina come across a broken bird’s egg. Wooow! Look at that: a little chick has literally just been born! But wait a minute: this particular egg is blue, and as far as they know, birds don’t lay blue eggs… Could it be from another type of animal?? And if so, which one? Super excited, T’choupi and Nina start searching for the mysterious creature that laid this blue egg…

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah preparing her morning and setting up her portable radio, she later stumbles upon a little kitten with black-lined ears mewing and walking around aimlessly. Looking for its mother, Farah realizes the kitten is lost and calls for help. Back in the garden, Leo is finishing up a birdhouse before Katie joins him. Katie suggests and puts in some seeds. Instead of a bird, Hero runs in chasing a baby squirrel and the squirrel gets into the birdhouse while Hero barks excitedly. Leo receives a call from Farah who tells Leo and Katie about a lost kitten. The rangers head up to the treehouse to learn more about it before agreeing to help her find the kittens mother. Leo, Katie And Hero arrives and find Farah in the forest with the kitten, still mewing restlessly. The rangers conclude the kitten may be looking for its mum, the rangers embark on a journey to help find the mum. They want to leave the clearings to find the kitten’s mum, but the kitten finds the children threatening so it hides away inside a bush nearby. The ranger manage to climb the kitten by giving it a squeaking toy to calm it down.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The doctor has come to give Simon and his little brother their yearly vaccination. Seeing that the boys are scared, the doctor suggests that Simon be his assistant! Simon takes his new role very, very seriously, even though the doctor himself does some pretty silly stuff. The two of them work so well together that Gaspard relaxes completely and the doctor is able to give him his vaccination shot without the little rabbit even noticing. Same for Simon who braves it out like a champ. Ha, doesn’t even hurt!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon goes strawberry hunting. Instead of strawberries, he finds a series of objects: a pair of red shoes, a blue shirt, and a yellow hat. With their help, he finds Annalee, who knows where to find lots and lots of strawberries.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A butterfly has entered the hall and cant find a way out. Sam and Julia use different strategies to capture the insect and get it back to freedom. But the butterfly doesnt seems to understand.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a toothache. His daddy goes to get Dr. Bobola, but Dan, his older brother, thinks the doctor is going to pull his tooth! To avoid this, Julia tries to takes care of Sam instead of the doctor.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Poet is convinced that the frog they found in the garden is actually a princess, but Girl disagrees: it must be a prince! The three kids come up with plans to find out: how about observing how the animal reacts to jewelry or to Toto dressed up as a dragon? But the frog does not blink and there seems to be only one last solution. Turbulent volunteers to give it a kiss! However, nothing happens and the little frog just hops away while Poet and Girl cannot stop laughing: "you kissed a frog!”

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom tells Poet that he should put his cuddly bear in the washing machine, but he does not want to. Mom tries to discreetly steal the bear, but it is easier said than done. Seeing that she is having a hard time, Turbulent and Girl decide to give her a hand to retrieve the cuddly toy, however their commando mission proves to be more complicated than they planned, and the little bear ends up even dirtier than before. Poet can only resign, but what a joy it is to hug a fresh and clean teddy bear.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: It’s a cold day, and Chug Patrol need more salt from the mines to keep Chuggington tracks safe in the icy weather. They escort the chuggineers up the mountain to the quarry, where the salt is mined. When they get there, Speedy is loading bags of salt onto a wagon using a pulley system. Jackman leaves Wilson in charge of things while he escorts Brewster back with the first load of salt. But when Jackman is detained by an accident, Wilson is the only Chug Patroller on the mountain -­‐ and when Fletch is trapped under a snowdrift, he has to think on his wheels.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: During a search and rescue drill on Annie’s Farm, Penny and Annie’s childhood rivalry leads to a heated game of hide and seek, a runaway horse, and a river rescue on board Hydrus and Phoenix.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy leads a whirlwind tour of the Seven Wonders of Pontypandy, but her haste to make it to all seven leads to a fire at her campsite!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper visits Tiger who is in bed with a really bad cold. Tiger is a demanding patient and none of the things Kipper has brought to cheer him up seem to work. In the end Kipper calls Pig and Arnold in to give the patient some of his medicine.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig asks Kipper to look after Arnold and says he’s really tired so he won’t be any trouble. Kipper reads to him, makes a house under the table, turns a cardboard box into a railway engine, but by the time Pig returns, it’s Kipper who can’t keep his eyes open.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou is sad when the sandcastle he built with Grandpa gets washed away. In a medieval fantasy, the Silver Knight (Caillou) helps the King (Daddy) rebuild his ruined castle, and Caillou learns that it’s the process of creating the castle that is the most fun.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou accidentally breaks Clementines mom’s dinosaur model, he guiltily hides it, but that makes his tummy hurt. In a castaway fantasy, helping Rexy cure his own guilty tummy ache helps Caillou realize the importance of owning up to a mistake.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai testing his new Kaizer upgrade, which detects sounds from afar. He picks up the sound of gushing water and a snow leopards yowl, leading him to investigate further. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a rescue mission game, communicate through their communication devices and pretend to find clues related to a lost hiker. They discover tracks and eventually locate the lost hiker, who is represented by a stuffed toy. They realize they need transportation to rescue the hiker and use Hero, the dog, as their "rescue transportation." The game was cut short as Leo receives a call from Kai on the animal he discover, which was revealed to be a snow leopard and is in trouble. The Junior Rangers agrees to help and meet up with Kai at his location. The Junior Rangers arrive in the mountains of Nepal. Kai struggles to pinpoint the exact location of the Snow Leopard due to the echo caused by the mountains. Hero uses his sense of smell and finds faint Snow Leopard paw prints, leading the group in the right direction. While following the paw prints, they encounter difficulties due to fresh snow covering the tracks. Leo uses binoculars to search for the well-camouflaged Snow Leopard.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is collecting plant specimens at the nature reserves when suddenly she sees an interesting fallen plant nearby and examines it. Then, she sees a pregnant walking catfish squirming about on the path. Weirded out by a fish on land, she calls in the Junior Rangers for some assistance. At the garden, Leo And Katie are playing animal charades. Katie manages to guess Leos chimpanzee performance but Leo cant figure out her Moths performance. Their game is interrupted by Zari, asking their thoughts on the struggling fish. The Junior Rangers get to the treehouse and learn more about the animal in the picture, revealing it as a Walking Catfish. Katie warns Zari not touch it as the fish may sting her with the spike on its spine. Another catfish appears and moves fast, causing Zari to worried if the catfish could be injured. She asks the Junior Ranger to help and the Ranger agree before hoping into PlatypusOne. As they arrive to the scene, the Junior Ranger ask Zari. on the fishs status and Zari replied not that great. They then decide to help the animal get to the nearest body of water and think on how to get the fish into the bucket without getting close to it. While Zari go fill up the bucket with water, Leo grabs the fish with his Backpack Grabber. Zari returns with bucket of water but Leo is having difficulties of grabbing the slippery fish. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky emerge from a bush, surprising the Junior Rangers. He tells them that he was revealing to study tadpoles nearby before meeting them.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Lizzy and Lauren arrange a horse riding lesson for Ben, and Pat brings Pumpkin the pony.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Michael is organising an open-air movie night, but the film is accidentally lost.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie play a game of hide and seek that unexpectedly turns into a game of lost and found when Weenie disappears. Worried, Oswald looks all over Big City in search of his pet and finally finds him – fast asleep under Johnny’s car seat. After making sure that Weenie knows never to hide in vehicles again they all celebrate with free ice cream!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and weenie have overslept only to find that everyone else in Big City has also overslept (well, not everyone – Daisy always gets up with the sun!) After waking Henry up, the gang walk through the deserted streets of Big City and reach Alarm Clock Building where they discover that the clock has mysteriously stopped. With the help of his friends, Oswald climbs inside the clock tower to discover the root of the problem – a sleeping squirrel!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are setting up the Spring City Halloween Festival. Everyone is excited except Lofty. Lofty thinks Halloween is scary, so when he is sent to collect a giant ghost decoration he is more than nervous. Meanwhile Wendy is trying to play a Halloween trick on Bob but keeps ending up with the joke on her. Lofty arrives to collect the ghost decoration from Curtis but even the crate it is stored in looks scary. Determined to be brave, Lofty picks up the crate. But then he hears a rattling sound and thinks it’s the ghost. He zooms off, still carrying the crated ghost, hoping to get his scary job over with. By rushing off, he doesn’t realise that the crate is not locked.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are building a special area to celebrate local citizens who have improved the life of Spring City. Each recipient will get to see his or her image inside a golden star on a plinth. But Mayor Madison is struggling to decide who exactly will feature in the very first golden star. Various suggestions include Mr. Bentley, who is very keen to be chosen, Tilly and Jenny. But when the Spring City Rockets suggest Betsy, Scoop decides that the honour should go to a machine – and that machine should be him. Scoop shows off in front of Maria hoping he will be chosen. But his reckless behavior results in cutting through an electric cable and causing a massive power cut.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are going camping and Timmy wants to build his own tent. What does he need for his camping trip?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids search for the owner of a sketchbook that contains drawings done from a high point of view. After determining the artist wasnt drawing at the top of a ladder or up in a tree, they discover the sketchbook belongs to one of Busytowns tallest residents, Jeremy Giraffe. / Huckle and gang investigate a strange temperature drop which turns Busytowns summer to winter.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messys hiccups cause a landslide while out on a nature walk, will he be able to find his way home? And will he ever stop hiccuping?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy has to deliver the giant pongberry to the Pongberry Pie Festival, before it goes off and releases a terrible pong in Okido City!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Asked by the girls to play Prince Berry Charming in the new play that Plum is directing for the Baby Berrykins, Huck pushes aside his reluctance and says yes. Bad goes to comically worse as the girls discover he can’t act, can’t dance, can’t sing, suffers from extreme stage fright, and never really wanted to do the play in the first place. After dress rehearsal devolves into a comedy of errors, Strawberry finally gets the sheepish Huck to confess that acting, singing and dancing are just not for him.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry finds a nest with an egg in it he wants to keep it, but Nana explains that it wouldnt be fair.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to stay up all night so he goes to Dino-World where he can play for as long as he wants.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A common tree frog hops into the garden one wet and rainy day. Leo, Katie and Hero take the frog to the forest, where Ranger Rocky directs them to find the frog’s breeding ground.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The Troublesome Trucks are being particularly cheeky and disobedient. When a new brake van called Bradford arrives from The Mainland Thomas is delighted to work with him as Bradford is excellent at keeping The Troublesome Trucks under control. But Bradford is a real stickler for the rules, and Thomas soon tires of his petty regulations, which are always making him late.. Eventually Thomas is so fed up with Bradford that he decides to go off without a brake van, a reckless and dangerous move, which ends up with Thomas hurtling out of control down Gordon’s Hill with no brake van to stop him.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Samson boasts proudly that he has been given a very special job taking stone from the quarry to the docks. But when he learns that Thomas has been given the same job he tries to find another way to prove how important he is. So he decides to take much more trucks than he should insisting that this will save time. But with so many heavy trucks Samson can’t get over Gordon’s Hill. So it takes even longer and when he asks Thomas to help him, he ends up making Thomas late too. The Fat Controller is not happy, but Samson insists that he’s learned his lesson and won’t make the same mistake again…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to pilot a special drone that Mr Guellec bought for his farm, where a Rainbow Magpie is ruining his fruits. The drone’s loudspeaker is supposed to emit a sound that will repel the bird in a harmless way, but things don’t go as planned. Not only does the Rainbow Magpie look unaffected by the drone, but it even mistakes it for a bird and chases after it. Grisu has a hard time shooing the bird away - with Fumè’s intervention making things worse - until he finds out that luring it to the nearby forest is much more effective…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu helps Toramento, who is setting up a sightseeing tour of the Pink Cave of the Valley. But some funny facts happen in the Cave: signs moving apparently by themselves, strange noises… Toramento suspects that a ghost lives there, but Grisu doesn’t believe it. After a little mayhem, the little dragon finds out that the funny facts are caused by a small but sassy bat, who lives in the Cave and is annoyed by artificial light. Eventually, Grisu, helped by Stella and Toramento, creates a light system built with luminescent rocks, that spreads a soft glow that doesn’t annoy the bat.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox is teaching Rosie and Woodsy how to find their way in the forest. The lesson becomes more difficult when Grandpa disappears. In order to find the way back to the burrow, Rosie and Woodsy will have to put into practice what they have learned and, above all, stop quarrelling.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Saffi has won a “Design a Statue” competition and now Bob and the team are turning her design into a water-fountain for the shopping mall. Saffi explains that her elephant statue design was based on her favourite toy, Mr Trunkers, but has since lost him. So when Muck is chosen to deliver the elephant statue, he promises to take extra special care of it for Saffi. But in his excitement, Muck accidentally knocks the elephant into a wall and scrapes off its paint. Muck can’t quite bring himself to own up to Saffi, so decides to tell Bob what has happened first. On his way to tell Bob, Muck overhears Anish telling Saffi how proud he is of her statue. Muck panics and ends up damaging the elephant more.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Skye Sampson asks Bob and Team to create a beach motocross course on Fixham Beach, Bob is so enthused he decides to compete himself. But it’s been a while since he’s ridden his old bike and he wonders if it will even make it round the course. While Bob and Curtis work on the bike, word gets out that there is a mysterious entrant called the Masked Biker. Scoop and Muck become convinced that the Masked Biker is Leo, hiding his identity to take part even though he isn’t old enough to race.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Someone in Busytown Park got rid of Sally and Hildas newly drawn hopscotch board. Huckle and Lowly set about helping the girls find out whos responsible. As it turns out the culprit isnt a who, but a what - the parks new sprinkler system washed the chalk drawing clean off the sidewalk./ Mr. Gronkle’s great great grandfather has hidden a priceless treasure somewhere and it’s up to Huckle and the gang to find it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an Atlantic puffin in the garden while playing with his remote-controlled car. The Junior Rangers decide to take the puffin home to Iceland. There, Leo has a mishap at the edge of a cliff.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: After an Asian palm civet steals Hero’s food, the Junior Rangers set off to bring the civet back to where it belongs. The trip takes them to the rainforest, a durian plantation and a run-in with a wild boar!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his little brother Gaspard are going to take the plane to go visit Grandpa and Grandma. And for the very first time, without their parents! Gaspard is a bit scared but Simon is there to reassure him and the nice stewardess takes wonderful care of them. During the trip they are going to be in for lots of surprises: they get to visit the cockpit, experience take-off, get a great tray of food, have magical views out the window…and even the turbulence is cool! When the plane lands, Grandma and Grandpa are there to greet them and Simon and Gaspard are more than ready for their next trip up in the sky!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole Max thinks his son Karl is too young to go camping with the other kids. Tilda changes Max’s mind and Karl happily joins the trip. He feels insecure until he helps Tilda in an emergency.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ida asks Molly, if she can look after her duckling Alina. But today of all days, Alina wants to learn how to fly and gets herself in some risky situations – and so Molly has to take some risks too.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole mother Gertrud has a cold, so Tilda watches her kids. The children teach Tilda how to dig. Unfortunately, Tilda’s tunnel leads directly to Rupert, who’s upset about the molehills in his garden.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare falls into a muddy Autumn puddle and is delighted when he startles Little Grey Squirrel, who doesn’t recognize him at first. This starts a great new game of ‘Surprise!’ as they dress up in disguises to surprise the others. But they weren’t ready for Little Field Mouse, who works out a clever way of surprising her friends even more.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their Town Crier badges, Wilson and Brewster each have to make an announcement, speaking loudly, clearly and with style. Brewster is too quiet and nobody listens to him. Wilson is loud and clear, but he exaggerates! Having failed their first badge attempt, Wilson and Brewster decide to help each other. Brewster teaches Wilson how to stick to the facts and Wilson gives Brewster pointers on announcing with pizzazz. They both earn their badges on the second try!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On the vibrant shores of an Indonesian island, Kai embarks on a thrilling adventure with his revolutionary Kaizer Drone, equipped with a cutting-edge animal translator capable of converting dolphin squeals into human speech. Later, he stumbles upon a mysterious whale that bore an uncanny resemblance to a fearsome shark. Meanwhile, in a nearby garden, Leo and Katie engage in training sessions with their loyal canine companion, Hero, using a bag of delectable animal treats to hone his communication skills. Amidst Heros baffling barks, Leo receives an urgent call from Kai, who unveils his astonishing discovery. Captivated by the intrigue, Katie and Leo agree to rendezvous with Kai when they learn that the magnificent whale shark has become ensnared in a fishing net. As the Junior Rangers arrive at Kais location, clad in their sleek wetsuits, they confront the sight of the majestic creature helplessly entangled. Contemplating the potential risks of liberating a shark, they find solace in the sudden arrival of Ranger Rocky, who imparts words of caution. Seeking expert advice, the Junior Rangers connect with Ranger Joey, who enlightens them on the harmless nature of the whale shark. After bidding farewell to Ranger Rocky, they summon their courage and attempt to free the captive creature.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was bird gazing in the rainforest, to which then she hears a birdcall from an unknown bird. She finally locates it and sees a unique male Superb Bird of Paradise, in the middle of doing its courting dance. Fascinated, Farah plans to call the Junior Rangers in learning more. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are having a friendly dancing competition. Hero joins them for a moment before Leo receives a call from Farah. Farah shares the bird picture to them and they learned its a Superb Bird of Paradise. They then worried if the bird might be injured so the Junior Rangers agree in meeting with Farah. The Junior Rangers arrives and quietly meet with Farah as they hide behind some bushes. They notice the bird is cleaning an open area. Misunderstood of the situation, the Junior Rangers thought the bird need help of building a nest so they scatter around to find materials to give to the bird. As they try to give the bird the materials they gather, the bird gets upset and clean again. Confused of the situation, they then get greeted by Ranger Rocky.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina finds T’choupi’s baby sister Fanni so cute that she suggests they go out and find other "babies," in the hamlet. Launching a "baby quest," she and T’choupi come across a chick, a baby rabbit, a caterpillar and a little snail! Next, they head to the woods to find more babies. But T’choupi suddenly gapes as he spots the cutest young animal of them all: a baby hedgehog, also known as a "hoglet."

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Luce has brought one of T’choupi’s favorite games: a Seek And Find game based on Nature! Mom comes along and suggests they go for a walk in the forest. The kids love the idea… as long as we can bring the game with! Mom agrees. But on the way, Luce drops the game, losing some of the pieces. She doesn’t say anything to the others, but when the time comes to start playing, the missing pieces make it impossible to continue past a certain point! Oh nooo!! So Mom suggests they play Seek And Find for real, in the forest! The first one to find a chestnut, a hedgehog or a frog…!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Paulie is very proud to bring his remote-controlled car to school! But the toy is not allowed … So when it accidentally runs over the director’s foot, the car is immediately confiscated! The only way in which Paulie will be able to recover the toy is if he behaves well, very well….

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The Treasure Cupboard: Julia wonders why her mum stores the gifts in the closet while Sams mum displays his in the living room. (S1, ep 15)

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam feels a little invaded by the birth of three babies at home. But Julia, who always dreamt of having brothers and sisters, finds the occasion to play doll. How to spend their afternoon together?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: After a benign little fall, Julia obtains a bandage from her mom: an occasion to be pitied in all the Mansion. But Julia needs to be sure no one, even Sam, discover the trickery...

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas’ new Italian friends, Lorenzo and his coach Beppe, do everything together, but one day, Lorenzo decides he’d like to do things by himself for a change. Beppe is hurt when Lorenzo leaves him behind so he can deliver the legendary Opera Star, Bella Canto, to a music festival. Lorenzo meets his match in Bella - she’s a soloist and a diva who wants to do everything by herself, her way! She doesn’t let Lorenzo join in with her singing and demands he take her a different route. Not wanting to let her down, Lorenzo follows her command, but without his trusty Beppe – and his sense of direction – they end up lost! Luckily, Beppe knows that, deep down, his friend needs him, so comes to rescue and the pair are reunited once more.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Its Darcy to the rescue when Monty falls down an old mine shaft while working on the new visitors park.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Mommy comes down with the Sniffle-Diffles and is unable to take Caillouand Rosie to the fair, so they decide to "make her better," with thehelp of Nurse Daddy. In the end, they forget all about the fair, havingso much fun helping Mommy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: On a super hot day, Caillou and Leo competitively play a lava level ofDig n Build. When Daddy tries plugging in a fan, he ends upoverloading the circuits, turning the TV and game off! As Leo andCaillou swelter in the heat, they begin to imagine lava rising in thehouse. They learn to work together to help save Gilbert from the lavaand get their game (and the AC) back on!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Its midday and Busytown citizens are dozing off all over town. Huckle, Sally and Lowly try to find out why. Noticing the number of sleeping people holding melted ice cream cones is an important clue. Ultimately, the kids discover that the ice cream truck isnt playing the usual perky tune to announce its arrival - its playing a lullaby./Someone has taken Huckle’s car and left their car in its place!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey has designed a paper airplane, he boasts how this will be the fastest paper airplane ever. But when he throws it, the plane immediately falls to the ground. When they meet Eagle they are impressed by his keen eye site and fast flying as he spotted Monkeys paper plane on the ground and glides down to get it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah and Mandy film a piece for the Scoop Dooley Show, and Scoop Dooley tries to make everything more sensational.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a mission to rescue Luc the wild boar, Moose ends up needing a rescue himself - and the multi - vehicle rescue gives Ellie a chance to show the Fire Cadets the importance of being slow and careful in a firefighter’s tasks.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Franklin emulates Mr. Heron and plays “post-turtle” for all his friends, he accidentally misplaces (and doesn’t deliver) a special drawing that Beaver made for Goose. It’s only when he accepts his responsibility in the mess-up, that he feels better about it. /Franklin and his friends make a get-well card for Snail but when Franklin carelessly leaves it on his window ledge, it falls into the road and gets caught up in the wind. Enlisting the help of all his friends to chase the card through a blustery Woodland day, Franklin tries to avoid telling them how it got lost in the first place. But it ends up feeling better to tell the truth.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As Woodsy is going to sleep over at Loudo’s, there is a spare place in the burrow. Rosie wants to invite Biva but Scoutbadger wants to invite Martis. Edmund, who does not like it when things get too boisterous, says only one friend can come. Scoutbadger and Rosie quarrel over which one can invite their best friend…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky dreams of going to the shooting stars night. But there will be a lot of people and Sketcky wants to get the best spot. Doodleboo knows exactly what he would need to arrive first tonight...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Bubble would like to see a new decoration in the jar and Doodleboo knows perfectly how to embellish it!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Its spring, the season of lovers and flowers! Sketcky would very much like to offer one to Bubble but first we need to let it grow and especially protect it against all kinds of threats. Doodleboo knows exactly what it takes to get away from anyone who wants to steal his friends seed...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave get to be fire-fighter helpers for the day and rescue Larry the Leopard Cub, who’s stuck in a tree! Using the ladder from Ruff-Ruff’s Rollypod Fire Truck they get Larry safely down; but can the fire-fighter helpers keep him from getting into more trouble and make sure Larry gets safely home!?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn how to speak monkey language. Bobby the Monkey teaches them his words for ‘follow me’, ‘coconut’, ‘food’ and ‘goodbye’, and at the end of a fun day together they discover ‘Bibble Bink’ means ‘new friend’. They’ve been on A New Friend Adventure all along!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle and the gang hear strange mumbling voices in the Busytown Museum, it begins to look like it’s coming from the new Mummy Exhibit. However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: The chef Monkey wants to make his famous banana honey sandwich. He discovers that there is no honey, parrot eat it all. Mole appears and tells them of the bees honey making abilities. They journey off to the meadow where they meet a sweet honeybee who not only supplies them with honey, but also joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman and Hannah are organizing a pool party for Peter, but Mike drops some decorations onto a lantern, and soon the rescue team needs to be called.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The bream has gone missing from the fish counter at the Wholefish Cafe, and Detective James is determined to crack The Case of the Missing Fish.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig is very proud of his new purple woolly sweater and shows it off to Kipper. Arnold spots a big red arrow, and then another, and they follow them into the woods. Pig doesn’t notice he has caught his sweater on a branch. The arrows were Tiger’s idea and he laughs at them from a tree he’s hiding in. Then he realises they’re lost. The unravelled wool from Pig’s sweater leads them back home.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Jake has lost something in the park – it’s a surprise so he can’t tell Kipper and Tiger what it is. They find a treasure map signed by Bluebeard the pirate and follow the clues. When they all meet up again Kipper and Tiger realise Jake lost the map. The treasure hunt was to be a surprise for Kipper’s birthday, but Jake’s even go the date wrong!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is proud to have been put in charge of feeding Nina’s animals while she’s away. But when he accidentally drops some eggs and commits a series of blunders, the animals change their behavior, and even seem to start avoiding him! Are they upset with T’choupi for being so clumsy?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi discovers Nina’s beautiful dried flowers. He’s so impressed that he wants to make his own collection, as a birthday present for his mom! So, he Nina and Benedicte secretly head off to pick some pretty flowers. But they’re going to have to turn it around fast: they only have one day to get the job done!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia lost her lucky seashell, brought back from her island. Sam helps her find it. The investigation leads them to the home of Mrs. Dreamer, the Mansions clairvoyant mouse. But can she really help?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Noises on the roof prevented Julia from sleeping last night. Those noises were made by Miss Astro that observe the night sky. Julia get nostalgic of the sky she could admire on her island...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert finds out that Molly has a beautiful singing voice and asks her if she can sing a song for Tildas birthday. Molly absolutely wants to do this but can she overcome her stage fright?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: On the beach, the Triplets are playing with Mommy’s bag, she scolds them nicely and tells them it’s time to go home ! But when she reaches for the keys, they are not here anymore ! They probably fell off the bag when the Triplets were playing with it. They have to find the keys or therwise everyone will have to sleep on the beach tonight - which by the way, sound good to the Triplets. Maybe raking the beach could be useful? Or then metal detectors, which would allow to find all the keys of the beach.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are watching a movie on television, when Poet starts to ask Mommy "How do you make a movie ?", she answers him that you need actors band a director to lead them and make the movie. Poet is very excited, when he’s a grown up, he wants to be a director and make animal documentaries. But his brother and sister do not agree with that, they want Poet to film them doing stunt, in a castle, with Dragons and sleeping beauties. Poor Poet will have to comply with the tantrums of his actors, not easy to do movies.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The Tomcats now consider Rosie as their "enemy number 1" instead of Scoutbadger. Blinded by rivalry, Scoutbadger is fooled by the cats who turn him against the fox so that they can steal a game of skittles. Our two heroes will finally join together to get back the skittles, especially as these belong to Woodsy…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his family head to a big, exciting Parade.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his family go ice skating, and Caillou accepts his limitations when he struggles to stay balanced.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Emily breaks down and disrupts a race between Connor and Caitlin, Caitlin shunts Emily to the castle causing Emily to travel faster than she ever has been before. Emily is in awe of Caitlin, who she believes is the best engine ever and becomes disheartened at her own ability. But when Caitlin’s brakes fail, Emily races to save her from an accident proving that she too can be a Really Useful Engine.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: It’s the Iron Chugger Challenge! The Chuggineers are competing with the Steam Team to pull a super-heavy load and cross the finish line first. Brewster can’t wait to take part – but when the Steam Team loses a member, Vee decides it’s only fair that the Chuggineers lose one too. The chugspin decides its Brewster. Disappointed, but wanting to help, Brewster volunteers for an urgent run to the quarry.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Chug Patrol organise an evacuation drill of the roundhouses. Wilson doesn’t do very well as no one will listen to him. Jackman tells him he has to learn to be calm and clear. When they practice evacuating animals at the Safari Park, Wilson is in charge of the monkeys. He does much better and even gets to the meeting point early.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Paulie is very proud to bring his remote-controlled car to school! But the toy is not allowed … So when it accidentally runs over the director’s foot, the car is immediately confiscated! The only way in which Paulie will be able to recover the toy is if he behaves well, very well….

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have to solve a series of puzzles to get themselves out of the amazing Puzzle Land maze.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today, T’choupi and his friends, Nina and Luce, must help Fred take his goats to a field a certain distance away. But when Loupiote the dog gets wounded and is unable to shepherd the goats, the kids are very disappointed. Until, all of a sudden, they get a brilliant idea: why don’t they stand in for Loupiote and play shepherd dog, to guide the goat herd to the grazing field?...!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle is nonchalantly playing with his boomerang in the Australian forest. But when it suddenly didnt came back, Kyle finds it behind a thick push. It turns out the boomerang has led him to a strange injured animal trapped inside a cage, accompanied with some blood and bandage in the cage. He felt worried so he calls in the Junior Ranger for help. Back in the garden, Hero finds a small branch with leaves and wanted to play fetch with Leo. Leo sees that theres an animal on the stick, to which Katie reveals that its a pupa and will transform into a butterfly. Then Leo receives a call where they later the animal is Pygmy Tarsier in the treehouse. The Junior Rangers agrees to help and ride PlatypusOne to meet up with Kyle. Once theyre there, they planned to help find the Pygmy Tarsier to a safe place for its to rest but Kyle opens up the cage as he was hypnotized by the animals eyes. The animal scrams away, causing the Rangers to go after it. The animal try to climb the tree but is unable because its hurt, and cant be approach by as it would trigger the animal to act hostile. Leo comes a plan and acts like a monkey to calm it down, to which it actually succeed.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: In the box of “RocoChoco” cereal, Simon is trying to get his hands on the toy at the bottom. It’s a “Chocosaurus”, a little, plastic dinosaur. Since he already has this one, Simon runs over to Ferdinand’s to give it to him. But when the door opens, Ferdinand is standing there with Mamadou, Simon’s other best friend. And he too, wants the “Chocosaurus”! The two friends blackmail him into…picking his best friend! Simon is faced with a heck of a dilemma: who should he give it to? Finally, thanks to Mom’s help, he understands that he doesn’t have to chose ONE best friend. He is going to make a couple of “Simonosauruses” for both friends, so each of them will have one!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: When foxes lose a canine milk-tooth, there is a little initiation ritual - the hunt for the little slug. Berry is delighted to show that she is big now but her brothers are rather jealous that they were not initiated when they were little. Edmund is very worried and wonders if it is really necessary that his little sweetheart takes some risks…

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Trying to keep cool on a sticky Summer’s day by the stream, Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare have lots of fun skipping stones and throwing sticks. When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that sticks float, the two follow the sticks down the river to see where they go. It’s not an easy chase, and there is a surprise around every corner. Where will the sticks end up?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon and Annalee come across a stray kitten. They give it dinner, have a bath, and Annalee reads a story, but the kitten disappears. They think it’s gone home, but at night, someone starts crying and whining...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has never left his residence and dreams of traveling the world. On the other hand, the world Julia knows the least is the Mouse Mansion. What if they played at traveling together staying there?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Today, Julia no longer feels at home among the other children and residents of the Mouse Mansion. And if her true place was finally in her island? Despite Sams efforts, she has decided to leave...

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets had planned to go to the circus today, but Mom is too sick and Grandpa too busy to take them. So here they are, stuck at home. But it does not matter! With a bicycle, balloons and lots of imagination, they can recreate a circus in moms room. Mom has to call for help and Grandpa will prove to be a wonderful acrobat!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets have each lost a sock and are wondering where they could have disappeared to. Maybe they are in the "Land of lost socks", suggests Poet. The kids start to imagine poor little lonely socks which have lost their twin sisters. So they decide to help them get back together again, but many are still missing. Could it be Totos fault or the washing machines? Hard to say but the Triplets have a solution: wearing unmatching socks!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Fire chugger Asher is giving Wilson some advanced fire training. As part of his training, Wilson has to go out on patrol and when he hears the alarm, he’s to rush back and put out a test fire Asher will set. While on patrol, Wilson runs into Koko and demonstrates some of his new skills with CP3, the Jetsprayer. Then the alarm sounds! Wilson races toward the training area -­‐ but has to wait, as a track is closed. While he’s waiting, a tarpaulin blows off a load and heads straight toward him. Wilson shoots it away, using CP3.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman and Hannah are organizing a pool party for Peter, but Mike drops some decorations onto a lantern, and soon the rescue team needs to be called.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The bream has gone missing from the fish counter at the Wholefish Cafe, and Detective James is determined to crack The Case of the Missing Fish.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper can’t understand where the contents of his cereal packet have gone, or why, when he know he put them away, his toys are littered all over the place. Then he discovers he’s got a little visitor – and life may never be the same again.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper and Pig see kangaroos and helicopters in the cloud shapes. Suddenly Arnold walks up a rainbow and Kipper has to go and find him. Is it all a dream?

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Leo is moving away to a new house and Caillou is angry that Leo seems excited about it. An imaginary train adventure shows Caillou that Leo’s moving doesn’t mean the end of their friendship; it’s just an obstacle that they will have to find a new path around.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou visits Leo in his new house and finds him unhappy, Caillou is determined to cheer up his friend. They play trains and go on a fantastical adventure where Leo learns to look on the bright side of a difficult situation, and Caillou learns how to better empathize with his friend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon and Rebecca do the same work, but differently. When Rebecca tries to be more like Gordon, it does not go well

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai was enjoying his time by the river, playing with a drone and conducting experiments with his unique smelling bombs. After a brief test that resulted in the area being engulfed in a green cloud, Kai noticed a peculiar creature emitting a peppery scent, prompting him to contact the Junior Rangers for assistance. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie engaged in a friendly competition, trying to determine whether their dog, Hero, would show more interest in his toy or a delicious treat. However, when they called Hero to make his choice, he disregarded both options. Suddenly, Leo received a call from Kai, who informed them about the mysterious creature he had encountered. Utilizing Katies computer, they identified it as a Giant Japanese Salamander. Upon learning that the salamander was trapped and potentially in danger, the Junior Rangers hurried to Kais location. Once there, they collaborated to move a rock, enabling the salamander to escape. However, they noticed that one of its feet had become detached. Concerned for the salamanders well-being, they embarked on a mission to find the missing limb. Fortunately, they encountered Ranger Rocky, who happened to be nearby. They explained the situation, leading Ranger Rocky to contact his colleague, Ranger Joey, for additional assistance. Ranger Joey enlightened them about the salamanders ability to regenerate its legs, relieving everyones worries about its condition.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: While lounging against a tree, Kyle engages in a whimsical conversation with his trusty toy kangaroo, Stella. Suddenly, a tiny lizard approaches him, sparking his curiosity. Eager to get a closer look, Kyles approach startles the lizard, causing it to gracefully glide away to another tree. Bursting with excitement, Kyle immediately contacts his fellow Junior Rangers, Leo and Katie. Meanwhile, Leo and Katies kite-flying adventure takes a nosedive when their kite crashes to the ground.
